trans-unit.source: An error occurred
What's the matter?
How can I fix the issue?
Tell me more, please
To customize this notice, create a custom Twig template overriding %s.
An error occurred while executing this script. Something does not work properly.
Open the current log file in the var/logs directory and find the associated error message (usually the last one).

The script execution stopped, because something does not work properly. The actual error message is hidden by this notice for security reasons and can be found in the current log file (see above). If you do not understand the error message or do not know how to fix the problem, search the Contao FAQs or visit the Contao support page.
Invalid request token
The request token could not be verified.
Please click this link and try again. Do not use the back button of your browser.

This error occurs if there is a POST request without a valid authentication token. In Contao 2.10, the referer check has been replaced with a request token system. If the problem persists, you may be using an incompatible third-party extension or have not correctly updated your Contao installation.
For more information, search the Contao FAQs or visit the Contao support page.
Service unavailable
The website is currently not available. Please come back later.
Legacy routing required
At least one extension requires legacy routing to work correctly, because it has not been updated to support the new routing system introduced in Contao 4.10.

Legacy routing can be activated by setting prepend_locale and/or url_suffix in the Contao configuration. Be aware that you can no longer set the URL prefix and suffix in the root page and existing configuration will be ignored!
To enable legacy routing, add the following to your config.yml and adapt it to your needs. Please refer to the Contao Documentation if you are unsure how to adjust the container configuration.
The following hooks are incompatible with legacy routing.
